Definition.WordDefinition: Onset, MA (CDP, FIPS 51160) Location: 41.74758 N, 70.66758 W Population (1990): 1461 (1189 housing units) Area: 2.8 sq km (land), 0.6 sq km (water) Zip code(s): 02532

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Onset \On"set`\, n. [On + set.] 1. A rushing or setting upon; an attack; an assault; a storming; especially, the assault of an army. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
The onset and retire Of both your armies. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
Who on that day the word of onset gave. --Wordsworth. [1913 Webster]
2. A setting about; a beginning; -- used especially of diseases or pathological symptoms. --Shak. [1913 Webster +PJC]
There is surely no greater wisdom than well to time the beginnings and onsets of things. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
3. Anything set on, or added, as an ornament or as a useful appendage. [Obs.] --Johnson. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Onset \On"set`\, v. t. 1. To assault; to set upon. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
2. To set about; to begin. [Obs.] --Carew. [1913 Webster]

onset n 1: the beginning or early stages; "the onset of pneumonia" [syn: {oncoming}] 2: (military) an offensive against an enemy (using weapons); "the attack began at dawn" [syn: {attack}, {onslaught}, {onrush}]
